reviewText: What can I say? I love Gary Cooper. Sergeant York is one of my favorites with a cast that includes a very young June Lockhart and young Walter Brennan.  The FountainHead is good And I believe Ayn Rand wrote the screen play for the movie. They are all good movies from the good old days.
These are 4 of his really good movies and it is subtitled. Which is a must for me. I enjoyed them very much although Fountainhead wasn't my favorite I love the other 3.
I would have bought this DVD for York alone, so it was a bonus to get the other movies as well. If you are a Gary Cooper fan these are all must have's for your movie collections.
These are movies that I wanted in my library.  I bought it because I think that Gary Cooper is a great actor and even though I had already watched each movie, I wanted to see them again.
Loved Sargent York and Friendly Persuasion.  Could do without the other 2.  They were not his best efforts.  Enjoyed the first two

Gary Cooper was an icon in the 50's and 60's for me as a teenager.  I loved going to the movies on Saturday night. Gary Cooper always deliver a believable character with certain manly emotions.  He is totally different type of male star to what you see today.

I had wanted the "Sgt. York" film and while that was available for around $16 by itself, I found this set of 4 Gary Cooper films plus one DVD for less to be very appealing  I love a bargain.  The discs were well mastered and each has extra features that explain some of the historical background and stage info that was involved in the making of these films.  An extra DVD in included that give more info on the "Sgt. York" film.  Yes, a thoroughly good purchase.
